results.title: Dental health - how and why
results.brief_description: A review of what research and experimentation have done to promote better dental health for the American public, including a report on diet and its relation to the growth and decay on teeth, new sodium fluoride applications and the latest techniques of oral hygiene. Shows different types of teeth, the effect of chewing on a tooth, the correct techniques of cleaning teeth.

results.title: Denial
results.creator_credit: Victorian College of the Arts and Phillip Crawford
results.brief_description: Kane is a 14-year old with a plan. Using his brother as bait, he steals some money off a man with a model train-set. But the plan goes wrong. If Kane is not careful the things that he wants to keep hidden will be let out. This film deals with the issue of sexual abuse through the eyes of a teenage boy who wants to forget. A very real and powerful portrayl of human nature. (Awards: Winner of the Southern Star Award for Best Film, Winner ATOM Awards 1998 Best Tertiary Short Fiction)

results.title: Demonstration in perception
results.creator_credit: United States. Dept. of the Navy
results.brief_description: Presents some of the demonstrations in use at Princeton University, USA, for research in perception. Apparatus employed in the demonstrations includes: three chairs; size, brightness apparatus; overlay table; stationary trapezoid; rotation trapezoid; distorted rooms.

results.title: Demon lover diary
results.creator_credit: DeMott, Kreines Films and Joel DeMott
results.brief_description: Demon Lover Diary is a documentary about the making of a low-budget horror film, but beneath the surface of this terse, incisive, cinema-verite study is a sense of real-life horror. DeMott’s boyfriend, Jeff is hired by Don and Jerry to photograph their film, “Demon Lover”. The production becomes a shambles and eventually explodes into violence.

results.title: Democratic curriculum
results.creator_credit: Dean Ashden, Focus Films and David Woodgate
results.brief_description: Provides an overview of the direction of education in Australia today as it comes to terms with changing society. Looks at schools in Victoria and South Australia and presents the views of educators, parents and children about the best ways educators can meet the needs of individual students. Considers goal based assessment, non sexist curricula and curricula supporting the needs of girls who have not received equal classroom opportunities. Outlines the underlaying principles behind the new ‘democratic curriculum’.

results.title: Democracy: your voice can be heard
results.brief_description: Illustrates the effectiveness of an individual in democracy by re-creating the true story of a campaign by Detroit students for improvements at a public hospital. Their involvement provides an example of the successful advancement of a cause.

results.title: Democracy: the role of dissent
results.brief_description: A democracy has legal channels for the redress of grievances. If these seem to fail, are other actions justified? A group of tenants are faced with this question as they demonstrate and consider a rent strike in protest against the living conditions in their apartment building.
results.description: A democracy has legal channels for the redress of grievances. If these seem to fail, are other actions justified? A group of tenants are faced with this question as they demonstrate and consider a rent strike in protest against the living conditions in their apartment building.

results.title: Democracy in action: the law has the last word

results.title: Democracy in action: social security in the Federal Republic of Germany
results.creator_credit: Ifage Filmproduktion (DE) and Curt Gerd Lotze
results.brief_description: A comprehensive survey of the social security system in Germany - the care of the aged, the compulsory medical benefits scheme for the labour force, and unemployment benefits. Also profiles rebuilding of post-war West Germany.

results.title: Democracy in action: every vote counts
results.brief_description: An election campaign. Every fourth year the Federal Parliament is elected. Half the members of the Bundestag are elected directly by the voters, whilst the other half of the representatives get their seats on a proportionate system.
